title: TV best bets: Mon., Oct. 12
text:
TV best bets: Mon., Oct. 12 October 12, 2015 Last updated: Monday, October 12, 2015, 1:20 AM The Record Buy this photo Jean Smart stars in "Fargo" at 10 tonight on FX. 
9 p.m., HISTORY CHANNEL: Alcatraz: The Search for the Truth — More than 50 years after John Anglin, Clarence Anglin and Frank Morris broke out of Alcatraz in 1962, never to be seen again, the family of the Anglin brothers comes forward with new evidence and secrets that finally could crack this iconic cold case. 
9 p.m., CBS: Scorpion — A literal voyage to the bottom of the sea is in store for Walter, Cabe and Happy (Elyes Gabel, Robert Patrick, Jadyn Wong) in the new episode "Robots." They're aboard a highly classified submarine when an explosion sinks it — and not only is the oxygen running out, the vessel is set to self-destruct. Peri Gilpin ("Frasier") guest stars. 
9 p.m., FOOD NETWORK: Halloween Baking Championship — In the new episode "Monster Mash-Ups," the six bakers spook judges Carla Hall, Sherry Yard and Ron Ben-Israel with their sculpted scary treats and then mash up flavors and themes to create devilishly delicious desserts. 
10 p.m., FX: Fargo — Season one of this quirky TV adaptation of an Oscar-winning film from the Coen Brothers earned a couple of Emmys and Golden Globe Awards, along with wild critical acclaim. There's a new cast, plot and backdrop, however, for season two, which follows a young married couple (Kirsten Dunst and Jesse Plemons) who get swept up in the crossfire of a war between two crime organizations and police in 1979 Minnesota and South Dakota. 
10:01 p.m., ABC: Castle — Castle (Nathan Fillion) tries to work through his grief to solve the case when his literary idol is killed in the new episode "What Lies Beneath."
